description: Monoclonal antibodies that inhibit tumor necrosis factor (TNF), used in the treatment of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
A group of inflammatory conditions of the gastrointestinal tract, primarily including Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis.
A cytokine with anti-inflammatory properties, playing a key role in regulating immune responses.
Receptors that bind to the Fc region of immunoglobulin G (IgG) and are involved in the immune response.
A subset of macrophages characterized by CD206 expression, associated with anti-inflammatory functions.
A subset of T-cells that are involved in the immune response, used in the study's model.
